title: What is dopamine fasting? The guide to Silicon Valley's latest trend
text:
Humans are wired to seek out pleasurable sensations over-and-over again, thanks to the release of a pesky chemical called dopamine to our brain.

In the Darwinian fight for survival, dopamine gave humans an edge, encouraging them to eat and socialise. But now that communicating, watching films, or ordering guilty pleasure foods have become as easy as tapping a smartphone, we have become gluttons for the dopamine hit they provide.

Psychology professor Dr Cameron Sepah, who claims to count a number of technology executives in Silicon Valley among his clients, believes this dependence is wreaking havoc on his patients' attention spans and has come up with an antidote to help them become more streamlined...
